page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The land in this area is flat and rich, ideally suited for agriculture. There are seven farms, six of which are both crop, and cattle and sheep rearing. The other specialises in the raising of Hereford bulls and exports them all over the world. A very large proportion of the land is owned by Miss Lancaster. She rents this land out to the farmers. The main crops grown in this area are: oil seed rape, barley, wheat, winter oats and seed hay. The farmers are unable to leave fields fallow as it is not financially viable. The machines that seem to be common on all farms are:3 tractors, combine drill, elevator, sucker blower, sprayer, fertiliser spreader, spring time harrow, mole drainer, baler, furrow plough and a rotary mower. The most common animals found are:beef & dairy cattle,pigs,bulls,sheep,chickens.
